awards.title: Sten Von Friesen Prize
awards.summary: For the advancement of measurement methods in particle physics and for the ambition of strongly linking particle physics and other disciplines.

funding.name: NetDRIVE SUSTRAIN - Sustainable Training Initiative
funding.description: Scientific progress relies on advanced computing and machine learning, and the environmental impact of digital research infrastructures to support this progress is increasing. Knowledge and tools to reduce this environmental cost are needed, and current training is scattered. This project will create  lessons, tutorials, and videos for audiences that haven't been reached by existing training, along with a central, sustainable database of resources to improve practices in green computing.

funding.name: EVERSE - European Virtual Institute for Research Software Excellence (Work Package leader)
funding.description: The EVERSE project aims to create a framework for research software and code excellence, collaboratively designed and championed by the research communities, in pursuit of building a European network of Research Software Quality and setting the foundations of a future Virtual Institute for Research Software Excellence.

funding.name: ERC Consolidator Grant - REALDARK
funding.description: In REALDARK, my team and I are deploying and using real-time analysis techniques in the LHC Run-3 dataset to help us detect rare processes involving dark matter in the ATLAS experiment at the Large Hadron Collider at CERN.

funding.name: MSCA Innovative Training Network - SMARTHEP (Coordinator)
funding.description: The SMARTHEP project trained 12 Early Stage Researchers in real-time analysis for particle physics and industry, with a focus on the development of new tools and techniques for the analysis of experimental data in machine learning. For more information, see The SMARTHEP website.

funding.name: Swedish Research Council Individual Project Grant
funding.description: In this project, I worked with a PhD student analysing the full Run-2 data for new phenomena in final states with quarks and gluons, and estimating the uncertainties on the physics objects used for the analysis. The PhD student working with me contributed to the testing and construction of the new Inner TracKer (ITK) that will be installed in ATLAS for the upcoming data-taking period starting in 2030 (HL-LHC).

funding.name: ERC Starting Grant - DARKJETS
funding.description: In DARKJETS, my team and I have designed and deployed the first prototype of real-time analysis in ATLAS in Run-2, and advanced the state of the art in terms of theoretical models used to target dark matter at colliders.

funding.name: Swedish Research Council Project Grant for Young Researchers
funding.description: In this project, I analysed the early Run-2 data for new phenomena in final states with quarks and gluons, and worked on the real-time decision-making system of the ATLAS experiment (trigger).
